content: Ay, a bit of Irish cheer for St Paddy’s day! Lynch’s obit or wiki is worth checking out. He was a pioneer of what we used to call “underground comix”. He supported that genre with his own output, by establishing a publishing company, and with academic study. And as you note, he was never one to reject mass marketing: on the contrary, he brought a subversive perspective to it, parodying advertisement and cliche cheerful kid-culture at just the moment kids most needed a clue.
